Round 9: Slip st over first 10 (11, 12, 13) sts, ch 1, starting in same st, BPsc in next 25 (26, 27, 28) sts, ch 12 (14, 16, 18), skip next 20 (22, 24, 26) sts, slip st in next st, ch 1, starting in same st, BPsc in next 25 (26, 27, 28) sts, ch 12 (14, 16, 18), slip st in slip st at base of beginning ch-1—74 (80, 86, 92) sts.  

Round 10: Ch 3, hdc in same st, skip next st, *(dc, hdc) in next st, skip next st; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—74 (80, 86, 92) sts. 

Round 11: Slip st in next hdc, ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), dc in same st, skip next dc, *(hdc, dc) in next hdc, skip next dc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2. 

Round 12: Ch 3, hdc in same st, skip next dc*(dc, hdc) in next hdc, skip next dc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3.

Size 2
Round 13-24: Repeat Rounds 11-12 (6 times).

Round 25: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, *sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around, ending with sc in last st, join with a slip st in first sc—111 sc. Fasten off.

Size 4
Round 13-26: Repeat Rounds 11-12 (7 times).

Round 27: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, *sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around, ending with sc in last st, join with a slip st in first sc—120 sc. Fasten off.

Size 6
Round 13-28: Repeat Rounds 11-12 (8 times).

Round 29: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, *sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around, ending with sc in last st, join with a slip st in first sc—129 sc. Fasten off.

Size 8
Round 13-32: Repeat Rounds 11-12 (10 times).

Round 33: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, *sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around, ending with sc in last st, join with a slip st in first sc—138 sc. Fasten off.

SKIRT
Round 1: With wrong side facing, using larger hook, join with a slip st in any sc of last Round, *ch 7, slip st in next sc; repeat from * around, pushing ch-7 loops to front of work, do not join—111 (120, 129, 138) ch-7 loops. Work in a spiral marking beginning of each Round, moving marker up as work progresses. 

Round 2-6: *Ch 7, slip st in next ch-7 loop; repeat from * around, continuing to push ch-7 loops to front of work. Fasten off at end of last row. 

FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Funfetti Cakes™ (8 oz/227 g; 239 yds/218 m)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Fsc = (Foundation single crochet). *Insert hook in “chain” of previous stitch and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 1 loop on hook (the “chain”). Yoh and draw through both loops on hook. Repeat from * for indicated number of stitches.
Note: A foundation single crochet consists of a base chain and a single crochet worked at same time
measurements: To fit chest measurement: XS/S/M 28-38" [71-96.5 cm]; L/XL/2XL 40-50" [101.5-127 cm]; 3/4/5XL 52-62" [132-157.5 cm]. Finished chest measurement: XS/S/M 43½" [110.5 cm]; XL/2XL 55½" [141 cm]; 3/4/5XL 65" [165 cm] (according to schematic)
gauge: 14 stitches (sts) and 5 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Mesh pattern (pat).
instructions:
The instructions are written for size XS/S/M. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written XS/S/M (L/XL/2X-3/4/5XL). When only one number is given, it applies to all sizes.
Note: Chain (ch) 5 at beginning (beg) of row counts as double crochet (dc) and ch-2 space (sp).
FRONT & BACK (Make 2 alike).
Ch 80 ( 101-125) [multiple of 3 ch +5].
**1st row: [Right Side (RS)]. 1 dc in 8th ch from hook (counts as skipped 2 ch, 1 dc, and ch-2). *Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 dc in next ch. Repeat (rep) from * to end of chain. Turn. 25 ( 32-40) ch-2 sps. 26 ( 33-41) dc.
2nd row: Ch 5  (counts as dc and ch-2 sp here and throughout). Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.**
Rep last row until work from beg measures 34 ( 36-38)" [ 86.5 ( 91.5-96.5) cm].
Fasten off.
SLEEVES (Make 2 alike)
Ch 56 ( 74-83) [multiple of 3 ch +5].
Rep from ** to ** as given for Front and Back.
17 ( 23-26) ch-2 sps. 18 ( 24-27) dc.
Rep last row until Sleeve measures 8½ ( 8½-7½)" [ 21.5 ( 21.5-19) cm].
Fasten off.
BELT
Ch 2.
1st row: Insert hook in 2nd chain from hook and draw up a loop. Yarn over hook (yoh) and draw through 1 loop on hook. Yoh and draw through both loops on hook - 1 foundation single crochet (fsc) made. Work 142 ( 181-220) more fsc. Fasten off.
Tie knot approx 1" [2.5 cm] in from each end of Belt.
FINISHING
Place markers (PM) 5¾ ( 8½-11¾)" [ 14.5 ( 21.5-30) cm] in from each side edge for Neck Opening. With Wrong Sides (WS) of Front and Back together (tog), using flat seam, sew shoulder seams from markers to side edges. PM 7½ ( 10-11¼)" [ 19 ( 25.5-28.5) cm] down each side edge from shoulder seam for armholes. Sew bottom of Sleeves around armhole opening, between armhole markers. PM 10" [25.5 cm] up each side edge from bottom for side slits. Sew sleeve and side seams to markers for slits. Weave in ends.
Weave Belt through ch-2 sps that sit at natural waist (try on Cover-Up to mark these sps). Ends of Belt meet at center front.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m) Contrast A Gold (39782) 2 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
1 yd [.9 m] of ¼" [0.65 cm] wide ribbon.
measurements: One size to fit 3-4 year old. Approx 20" [51 cm] long x 12" [30.5 cm] at shoulders.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Dress is worked in rows from top down. Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
With A, ch 62.
1st row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 60 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 70 dc.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 80 dc.
4th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 90 dc.
5th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 100 dc.
6th and 7th rows: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
8th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 14 dc. Ch 5. Skip next 20 dc (armhole). 1 dc in each of next 30 dc. Ch 5. Skip next 20 dc (second armhole). 1 dc in each of next 15 dc. Turn.
9th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 14 dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 ch. 1 dc in each of next 30 dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 ch. 1 dc in each of next 15 dc. Turn. 70 dc.
10th to 14th rows: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
15th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in next dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 105 dc.
16th to 39th rows: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Back edging: With RS facing, join A with sl st to bottom right corner. Ch 1. Work 1 row of sc evenly up to top right corner. Fasten off. With RS facing, join A with sl st to top left corner. Ch 1. Work 1 row of sc evenly down to bottom left corner. Fasten off.
Bottom, neck and back edging: With RS facing, join B with sl st to bottom left corner. Ch 1. Work 1 row sc evenly along bottom edge, up back edge, along neckline and back down the other side of back edge. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Armhole edging: With RS facing, join B with sl st to any sc in Armhole. Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around Armhole. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Daisy Pockets
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join B with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. (Middle of Daisy should puff out just a little).
4th rnd: *Ch 10. 1 tr in 4th ch from hook. 1 tr in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Skip next sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * around. 6 petals.
5th rnd: Ch 1. Work 1 rnd sc evenly around each petal, working 3 sc in top of each petal and sl st in next sl st of previous rnd. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc, working 2 sc in each of 3 sc at top of each petal. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
FINISHING
Sew Daisies to bottom of dress, leaving top petal un-sewn (if desired) so it functions as a pocket.
Sew buttons evenly along right side of back edge (using holes of dc on opposite side as buttonholes). String white ribbon over and under dc sts in 14th row. Tie bow in front of dress.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 334 Buff A, 774 Light Raspberry B, 358 Lavender C, and 672 Spring Green D
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
gauge: 13 sts = 4” (10 cm); 9 rows = 4” (10 cm), in half double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
DRESS
Bodice
Round 1 (right side): With A, Fhdc 48 (50, 50, 54, 54); taking care not to twist sts, join with slip st in first Fhdc—48 (50, 50, 54, 54) sts. 
Note When completing round, work last stitch(es) in front of beginning chains and in skipped stitch before joining last stitch to first hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (does not count as a st here and throughout), skip next st, *hdc in next 23 (4, 4, 8, 8) sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—50 (60, 60, 60, 60) sts.
Round 3: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 4 (5, 5, 5, 5) sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—60 (70, 70, 70, 70) sts.
Round 4: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 5 (6, 6, 6, 6) sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—70 (80, 80, 80, 80) sts.
Round 5: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 6 (7, 7, 7, 7) sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—80 (90, 90, 90, 90) sts.
Round 6: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 7 (8, 8, 8, 8) sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—90 (100, 100, 100, 100) sts.
Directions are for size 2 years. Changes for sizes 4 years, 6 years, 8 years, and 10 years are in parentheses.

Special Stitches
dc3tog = [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops] 3 times, yarn over, draw through all 4 loops on hook.
Fhdc (Foundation half double crochet) (This technique creates a foundation chain and a row of half double crochet stitches in one) = Step 1: Place a slip knot on hook, ch 3, yarn over, insert hook in 3rd ch from hook and draw up a loop; yarn over and draw through one loop on hook (the “chain”); yarn over and draw through 3 loops on hook (the “half double crochet”). 
Step 2: Yarn over, insert hook into the “chain” of the previous stitch and draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through one loop on hook (the “chain”), yarn over and draw through 3 loops on hook (the “half double crochet”); repeat step 2 for the length of foundation.
hdc2tog = [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop] 2 times, yarn over and draw through all 5 loops on hook.

Notes
1. Dress is worked from the top down in 2 sections: bodice and skirt.
2. Bodice is worked in seamlessly joined rounds with right side facing at all times. One stitch is skipped at the beginning of each round and the last stitch(es) are worked into the skipped stitch before joining the round with a slip stitch.

4th row: Ch 2. 3 dc in first dc. Ch 1. *3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to center ch-2 sp. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. **3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from ** to end of row. 3 dc in last dc. Turn.
First 4 rows of Stripe Pat are complete.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last row 12 (14-16-18-20-23) times more. 32 (36-40-44-48-54) groups of 3-dc, 30 (34-38-42-46-52) ch-1 sps, and 1 ch-2 sp.
Straight Side Shaping: Next row: Ch 3. *3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to next ch-2 sp. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. **Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from ** to last 3 dc and ch-2. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 3. *3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to next ch-2 sp. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. **Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from ** to last 3 dc and ch-3. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last row until work measures approx 33 (33-33-34-34-35) long from magic loop in foundation row to ch-2 point of last row, ending on a WS row.
Shape Left Front/Right Back Armhole Shaping: 1st row: (RS). Ch 3. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next ch-2 sp. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Cont on 15 (17-19-21-23-26) groups of 3-dc.
2nd row: (WS). Ch 3. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 3 dc and ch-3. 1 dc in top of ch-3. Turn. Fasten off. 14 (16-18-20-22-25) groups of 3-dc.
With RS facing, keeping cont of Stripe Pat, join appropriate color with sl st to 3rd (3rd-5th-5th-7th-10th) ch-1 sp from right.
3rd row: (RS). Ch 3. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 3 dc and ch-3. 1 dc in top of ch-3. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. *3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. Dc2tog over ch-1 sp and last dc. Turn.
Rep 3rd and 4th rows until 2 groups of 3-dc and 1 dc2tog rem.
Strap: 1st row: (RS). Ch 3. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice. 3 dc in last dc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 3 dc in first dc. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows twice more. Fasten off.
Right Front/Left Back Armhole Shaping:
With RS facing, keeping cont of Stripe Pat, join appropriate color with sl st to ch-2 sp.
1st row: (RS). Ch 3. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 3 dc and ch-3. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 15 (17-19-21-23-26) groups of 3-dc.
2nd row: Ch 3. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 3 dc and ch-3. 1 dc in top of ch-3. Turn. 14 (16-18-20-22-25) groups of 3-dc.
3rd row: Ch 3. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 9 (11-11-13-13-13) times. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
4th row: Ch 2. Dc2tog over first dc (skip next 3 dc) and next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 3 dc and ch-3. 1 dc in top of ch-3. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3. *3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. 1 dc in last dc2tog. Turn.
Rep 4th and 5th rows until 2 groups of 3-dc and 1 dc2tog rem.
Strap: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 3 dc in next dc. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice. 3 dc in last dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 3 dc in first dc. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows once more, then 2nd row once. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew side and shoulder seams.
Neckband: 1st rnd: (RS). Beg at shoulder seam, join A with sl st to neck edge. Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around neck edge. Break A. Join B with sl st to first sc. ***Next rnd: With B, ch 1. Work 1 sc in each sc around. Break B. Join A with sl st.
Next rnd: With A, rep last rnd once more. Fasten off.***
Armbands: 1st rnd: (RS). Beg at side seam, join A with sl st to armhole edge. Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around armhole. Break A. Join B with sl st to first sc. Work from *** to *** as given for Neckband.
Fringe
Cut strands of A and B 12" [30.5 cm] long. Holding 4 strands of same shade tog, and matching shade to dc being worked into, work fringe into top of each dc around bottom edge of Skirt. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: RED HEART® Soft Baby Steps®: 1 (1, 2, 2) balls 9600 White A.
RED HEART® Boutique Sassy Fabric™: 2 hanks 9936 Pink Dot B.
abbreviations: A and B = Yarn A, and Yarn B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements:
Finished Chest: 18 (19, 20½, 22)” (45.5 (48.5, 52, 56) cm).
Finished Length: 14¾ (16, 17¾, 18)” (37.5 (40.5, 45, 45.5) cm), including 1¾” (4.5 cm) of B that hangs below lower edge of dress.
gauge: 12 sts = 4” (10 cm); 15 rows = 4” (10 cm) in sc and sassy-sc skirt pattern. 12½ sts = 4” (10 cm); 10½ rows = 4” (10 cm) in cross-sc bodice pattern.
instructions:
SKIRT
Beginning at lower edge with A, ch 71 (80, 88, 98); being careful not to twist ch, join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in same ch as joining and in each ch around; do not join, work in a continuous spiral—71 (80, 88, 98) sc. Place a marker in last stitch made to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Fold B (see Note #3), hold B in front of work, insert hook through aligned holes then insert hook in next st, yarn over with A and draw through st and aligned holes, yarn over with A and draw through both remaining loops on hook, work sassy-sc in each st around.
Rounds 3 and 4: With A only, sc in each st around.
Round 5 (decrease round): With A only, sc in first 1 (0, 0, 1) sts, [sc in next 21 (18, 20, 17) sts, sc2tog] 3 (4, 4, 5) times, sc in last 1 (0, 0, 2) sts—68 (76, 84, 93) sc.
Round 6: Work sassy-sc in each st around.
Rounds 7 and 8: With A only, sc in each st around.
Round 9 (decrease round): With A only, sc in first 1 (0, 0, 1) sts, [sc in next 20 (17, 19, 16) sts, sc2tog] 3 (4, 4, 5) times, sc in last 1 (0, 0, 2) sts—65 (72, 80, 88) sc.
Rounds 10–12: Repeat Rounds 6–8.
Round 13 (decrease round): With A only, sc in first 1 (0, 0, 1) sts, [sc in next 19 (16, 18, 15) sts, sc2tog] 3 (4, 4, 5) times, sc in last 1 (0, 0, 2) sts—62 (68, 76, 83) sc.
Rounds 14–16: Repeat Rounds 6–8.
Round 17 (decrease round): With A only, sc in first 1 (0, 0, 1) sts, [sc in next 18 (15, 17, 14) sts, sc2tog] 3 (4, 4, 5) times, sc in last 1 (0, 0, 2) sts—59 (64, 72, 78) sc.
Rounds 18–20: Repeat Rounds 6–8.
Round 21 (decrease round): With A only, sc in first 1 (0, 0, 1) sts, [sc in next 17 (14, 16, 13) sts, sc2tog] 3 (4, 4, 5) times, sc in last 1 (0, 0, 2) sts—56 (60, 68, 73) sc.
Rounds 22–24: Repeat Rounds 6–8.
Round 25 (decrease round): With A only, sc in first 56 (60, 0, 1) sts, [sc in next 0 (0, 15, 12) sts, sc2tog] 0 (0, 4, 5) times, sc in last 0 (0, 0, 2) sts—56 (60, 64, 68) sc.
Round 26: Repeat Round 6.
Rounds 27–29: With A only, sc in each st around.
Repeat last Rounds 26–29, 0 (0, 1, 1) more times.
Last Round: Work sassy-sc in each st around to last st, cut B so that 2 holes remain, fold B (see Note #4), sassy-sc in last st; join with slip st in first st.
Do not fasten off A. Work remainder of Dress with A only.
BODICE
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, cross-sc across to last st, sc in last st, TURN – 56 (60, 64, 68) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, cross-sc across, turn.
Rows 3–4 (6, 8, 8): Repeat last 2 rows 1 (2, 3, 3) more times.
Left Back
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in first st, [cross-sc] 6 (6, 6, 7) times, sc in last 0 (1, 1, 0) sts, turn; leave remaining sts unworked for Front and Right Back—13 (14, 14, 15) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 0 (1, 1, 0) sts, [cross-sc] 6 (6, 6, 7) times, turn—12 (13, 13, 14) sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, [cross-sc] 5 (6, 6, 6) times, sc in last 1 (0, 0, 1) sts, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 1 (0, 0, 1) sts, [cross-sc] 5 (6, 6, 6) times, turn—11 (12, 12, 13) sts.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first st, [cross-sc] 5 (5, 5, 6) times, sc in last 0 (1, 1, 0) sts, turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first 1 (0, 0, 1) sts, [cross-sc] 5 (6, 6, 6) times, turn.
Rows 7–8 (8, 8, 10): Repeat last 2 rows 1 (1, 1, 2) more times.
Repeat Row 5, 0 (1, 1, 0) more times.
Shape Left Back Shoulder
Size 6 months only:
Row 1: Slip st in first 7 sts, ch 1, sc same st as last sl st, [cross-sc] twice, turn—5 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first st, [cross-sc] twice.
Sizes 12 (18) months only:
Row 1: Ch 1, [cross-sc] 3 (2) times, sc in next 0 (1) sts, turn; leave remaining sts unworked—6 (5) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 1 (0) sts, [cross-sc] twice, sc in last st.
Size 24 months only:
Row 1: Slip st in first 8 sts, ch 1, beginning in same st as last sl st, [cross-sc] 3 times, turn—6 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first st, [cross-sc] twice, sc in last st.
All sizes: Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Front
Row 1 (right side): With right side facing, skip next 2 (2, 4, 4) unworked sts of last row of Bodice, join A in next st, ch 1, beginning in same st as joining, sc in 0 (1, 1, 0) sts, [cross-sc] 13 (13, 13, 15) times, sc in next 0 (1, 1, 0) sts, turn; leave remaining sts unworked for Right Back—26 (28, 28, 30) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 0 (1, 1, 0) sts, [cross-sc] 12 (12, 12, 14) times, sc in next 0 (1, 1, 0) sts, turn; leave last st unworked—24 (26, 26, 28) sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 1 (0, 0, 1) sts, [cross-sc] 11 (13, 13, 13) times, sc in last 1 (0, 0, 1) sts, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 1 (0, 0, 1) sts, [cross-sc] 10 (12, 12, 12) times, sc in next 1 (0, 0, 1) sts, turn; leave last st unworked—22 (24, 24, 26) sts.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first 0 (1, 1, 0) sts, [cross-sc] 11 (11, 11, 13) times, sc in last 0 (1, 1, 0) sts, turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first 1 (0, 0, 1) sts, [cross-sc] 10 (12, 12, 12) times, sc in last 1 (0, 0, 1) sts, turn.
Row 7: Repeat Row 5.
Shape Right Front Shoulder
Row 1 (wrong side): Ch 1, sc in first 1 (0, 0, 1) sts, [cross-sc] 3 (4, 3, 3) times, sc in next 0 (0, 1, 1) sts, turn; leave remaining sts unworked for front neck and Left Shoulder—7 (8, 7, 8) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 0 (0, 1, 1) sts, [cross-sc] 3 (3, 2, 3) times, sc in last 0 (1, 1, 0) sts, turn—6 (7, 6, 7) sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 1 (0, 0, 1) sts, [cross-sc] 2 (3, 2, 2) times, sc in next 0 (0, 1, 1) sts, turn; leave last st unworked—5 (6, 5, 6) sts.
Sizes 12 (18, 24) months only: Ch 1, sc in next 1 (0, 0) sts, [cross-sc] 2 (2, 3) times, sc in last 1 (1, 0) sts, turn.
Size 24 months only: Ch 1, sc in first st, [cross-sc] twice, sc in last st.
All sizes: Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Shape Left Front Shoulder
Row 1 (wrong side): With wrong side facing, skip next 8 (8, 10, 10) sts of last row of Front, join A in next st, ch 1, beginning in same st as joining, sc in 0 (0, 1, 1) sts, [cross-sc] 3 (4, 3, 3) times, sc in last 1 (0, 0, 1) sts, turn—7 (8, 7, 8) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 0 (1, 1, 0) sts, [cross-sc] 3 (3, 2, 3) times, sc in next 0 (0, 1, 1) sts, turn; leave last st unworked—6 (7, 6, 7) sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 0 (0, 1, 1) sts, [cross-sc] 2 (3, 2, 2) times, sc in next 1 (0, 0, 1) sts, turn—5 (6, 5, 6) sts.
Sizes 12 (18, 24) months only: Ch 1, sc in next 1 (1, 0) sts, [cross-sc] 2 (2, 3) times, sc in last 1 (0, 0) sts, turn.
Size 24 months only: Ch 1, sc in first st, [cross-sc] twice, sc in last st.
All sizes: Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Right Back
Row 1 (right side): With right side facing, skip next 2 (2, 4, 4) unworked sts of last row of Bodice, join A in next st, ch 1, beginning in same st as joining, sc in 0 (1, 1, 0) sts, [cross-sc] 6 (6, 6, 7) times, sc in last st, turn—13 (14, 14, 15) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, [cross-sc] 6 (6, 6, 7) times, sc in next 0 (1, 1, 0) sts, turn; leave last st unworked—12 (13, 13, 14) sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 1 (0, 0, 1) sts, [cross-sc] 5 (6, 6, 6) times, sc in last st, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, [cross-sc] 5 (6, 6, 6) times, sc in next 1 (0, 0, 1) sts, turn; leave last st unworked—11 (12, 12, 13) sts.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first 0 (1, 1, 0) sts, [cross-sc] 5 (5, 5, 6) times, sc in last st, turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, [cross-sc] 5 (6, 6, 6) times, sc in last 1 (0, 0, 1) sts, turn.
Rows 7–8 (8, 8, 10): Repeat last 2 rows 1 (1, 1, 2) more times.
Repeat Row 5, 0 (1, 1, 0) more times.
Shape Right Back Shoulder
Size 6 months only:
Row 1: Ch 1, [cross-sc] twice, sc in next st, turn; leave remaining sts unworked—5 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, [cross-sc] twice, sc in last st.
Sizes 12 (18) months only:
Row 1: Slip st in first 7 (8) sts, ch 1, sc in same st as last slip st 0 (1) times, [cross-sc] 3 (2) times, turn—6 (5) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first st, [cross-sc] twice, sc in last 1 (0) sts.
Size 24 months only:
Row 1: Ch 1, [cross-sc] 3 times, turn; leave remaining sts unworked—6 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first st, [cross-sc] twice, sc in last st.
All sizes: Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
With right side facing, sew shoulder seams.
Buttonhole Band
Row 1 (right side): With right side facing, join A at top of right neck opening (on Back), ch 1, working in ends of rows down right back opening, work 13 (16, 18, 19) sc evenly spaced across, turn—13 (16, 18, 19) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 3 (2, 4, 5) sts, [ch 1, skip next st (buttonhole), sc in next 3 sts] 2 (3, 3, 3) times, ch 1, skip next st (buttonhole), sc in last st, turn—3 (4, 4, 4) buttonholes made.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc and ch across.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Weave in ends.
Button Band and Neck Edging
Row 1 (right side): With right side facing, join A at bottom of left back opening, ch 1, working in ends of rows up left back opening, work 13 (16, 18, 19) sc evenly spaced across (for Button Band); working across neck edge, ch 1, sc evenly spaced across neck edge, turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first st, ch 1, skip next st (buttonhole), sc in each st across neck edge only (to the ch-1 sp), turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, slip st in each st and ch across. Fasten off.
Sew bottom of Buttonhole Band over first st of Button Band and first 2 sts of Bodice. Sew buttons across Button Band, opposite buttonholes.
Armhole Edging
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing, join A in armhole edge at underarm, ch 1, sc evenly spaced all the way around armhole edge; do not join, work in a continuous spiral.
Round 2: Slip st in each st around. Fasten off. Repeat edging around second armhole.

materials: Caron® Colorama Lacy™ (8 oz/227 g; 361 yds/330 m)
Sizes XS/S M L Berry Patch 3 4 4 balls (11009) 1040/951 1141/1043 1294/1183 yds/m
Sizes XL 2/3XL 4/5XL Berry Patch 4 5 6 balls (11009) 1397/1277 1556/1443 1828/1671 yds/m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through remaining 3 loops on hook.
gauge: 9 stitches (sts) and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pattern (pat)
instructions:
The instructions are written for XS/S. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written XS/S (M-L-XL-2/3XL-4/5XL). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

Approx = Approximately
Beg = Begin(ning)
Ch = Chain(s)
Dc = Double crochet
Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through remaining 3 loops on hook.
Cont = Continue(ity)
Pat = Pattern
Rem = Remaining
Rep = Repeat
RS = Right side
Sc = Single crochet
Sl st = Slip stitch
St(s) = Stitch(es)
Tog = Together
WS = Wrong side
Y oh = Yarn over hook

Notes:
• Chain 2 (ch-2) at beginning (beg) of row does not count as stitch (st).
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as double crochet (dc).
• Dress is worked flat from bottom edge up and then seamed.

FRONT & BACK (make alike)
Ch 42 ( 46-51-55-60-69).
1st row: [Wrong Side (WS)]. 1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 41 ( 45-50-54-59-68) sc.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 double crochet (dc) in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. 1 sc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Last 2 rows form pattern (pat).
Continue (cont) in pat until work from beg measures approximately (approx) 38" [96.5 cm] (approx 76 rows), ending on a 2nd row (RS).
Armhole shaping: 1st row: (WS). Slip stitch (sl st) in each of first 1 ( 1-1-2-2-3) dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 39 ( 43-48-50-55-62) dc. Turn. Leave remaining (rem) st(s) unworked. 39 ( 43-48-50-55-62) sc.
2nd to 5th rows: Pat even.
6th row: (RS). Ch 2. Double crochet 2 together (Dc2tog). 1 dc in each sc to last 2 sc. Dc2tog. Turn. 37 ( 41-46-48-53-60) sts.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 7th rows 1 ( 1-1-1-2-2) time(s) more. 35 ( 39-44-46-49-56) sc at end of last row. 

Work 2 ( 2-4-4-0-2) rows even in pat.
First Strap: 1st row: (RS). Ch 3. 1 dc in each of first 6 ( 7-9-10-11-14) sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 7 ( 8-10-11-12-15) dc.
Cont on these 7 ( 8-10-10-11-14) sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc to end of row. Fasten off.

Second Strap: With RS facing, skip next 21 ( 23-24-24-25-26) sc. Join yarn with sl st to next sc.
1st row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of last 6 ( 7-9-10-11-14) sc. Turn. 7 ( 8-10-11-12-15) dc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc to end of row. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Align Front and Back, WS facing each other. Sew shoulder seams. Sew side seams from bottom of armhole to desired Slit length.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® Brites™ (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit chest measurement: 12-18 mos 20" [51 cm], 4 yrs 23" [58.5 cm], 6 yrs 26" [66 cm]. Finished chest: 12-18 mos 25" [63.5 cm], 4 yrs 28½" [72.5 cm], 6 yrs 34" [83.5 cm].
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. Note: Ch 2 at beg of row/rnd does not count as st.
CROCHET I SKILL LEVEL: EASY MEDIUM
With A, ch 71 (93-121).
1st row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each of next 5 (8-12) ch. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 19 (24-29) ch. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 13 (19-29) ch. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 19 (24-29) ch. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next ch. 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. [1 dc in each st to next ch-2 sp. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in ch-2 sp] 4 times. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. [1 dc in each st to ch-2 sp. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in ch-2 sp. Ch 5. Skip all stitches to next ch-2 sp. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in ch-2 sp] twice. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Join to work in the rnd with sl st to first sc.
Proceed in rnds as follows:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
1st rnd: Ch 2. [1 dc in each st to next ch-2 sp. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each st and ch to next ch-2 sp. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in ch-2 sp] twice. 1 dc in each st to end of rnd. Join.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 2. [1 dc in each st to next ch-2 sp. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in ch-2 sp] 4 times. 1 dc in each st to end of rnd. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in each st and ch-2 sp around. Join. 81 (93-111) sts.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in each dc around. Join.
Rep 5th rnd 10 (18-20) times more.
Work colorwork as follows:
Note: When joining new color, work to last 2 (3) loops on hook. Draw new color through last 2 (3) loops, then proceed in new color. Carry color when not in use loosely across top of previous row and work sts around it to avoid stranding.
1st rnd: Ch 2. *With A, 1 dc in each of first 2 sts. With B, (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice in next st. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – 2 dc cluster made. Rep from * around. Join.
2nd rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
3rd rnd: With C, ch 2. 1 dc in each st around. Join.
4th rnd: With D, ch 2. 1 dc in each st around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. Skip first 3 (3-1) st(s). *4 dc in next dc. Skip next st. Sl st in next st. Skip next st. Rep from * around, ending last rep with a sl st in first skipped st of rnd. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew button to left side of back opening, aligned with 2nd row of dc sts. Use space between 1st and 2nd dc on right side as buttonhole.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Baby™ (5 oz/140 g; 362 yds/331 m)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
One size U.S. 19 (15 mm) knitting needle for Broomstick crochet technique.
abbreviations: Dc3tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all 4 loops on hook
measurements: To fit chest measurement: 6 mos 17" [43 cm], 12 mos 18" [45.5 cm], 18 mos 19" [48.5 cm]. Finished chest: 6 mos 19" [48.5 cm], 12 mos 20" [51 cm], 18 mos 21" [53.5 cm]
gauge: 16 sc and 19 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 20 dc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Body Pat.
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
• Dress is worked in one piece from neck edge down.
• Center back has an opening for buttons, then Body is joined in rnd.
• For Yoke ruffles use Broomstick crochet technique.

DRESS
Beg at neck edge, with MC ch 44 (46-46).
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 42 (44-44) dc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc to end of row. Turn. Join A.
3rd row: With A, working in back loops only of each sc, ch 3. (2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc) 12 times. 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 54 (56-56) dc.
4th row: As 2nd row. Join MC.
5th row: With MC, working in both loops of each sc, ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 4 sc. (2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 3 sc) 12 times. 1 dc in last sc. Turn. 66 (68-68) dc.
6th row: As 2nd row. Join A.
7th row: With A, working in back loops only of each sc, ch 3. (2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 4 sc) 12 times. 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 78 (80-80) dc.
8th row: As 2nd row. Join MC.
9th row: With MC, working in both loops of each sc, ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 6 sc. (2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 5 sc) 12 times. 1 dc in last sc. Turn. 90 (92-92) dc.
10th row: As 2nd row. Join A.
11th row: With A, working in back loops only of each sc, ch 3. (2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 6 sc) 12 times. 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 102 (104-104) dc.
12th row: As 2nd row. Join MC.
13th row: With MC, working in both loops of each sc, ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 8 sc. (2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 7 sc) 12 times. 1 dc in last sc. Turn. 114 (116-116) dc.
14th row: As 2nd row.
Sizes 12 and 18 mos only: 15th row: With A, working in back loops only of each sc, ch 3. (2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 8 sc) 12 times. 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn. (128-128) dc.
16th row: As 2nd row. Join MC.
Size 18 mos only: 17th row: With MC, working in both loops of each sc, ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 10 sc. (2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 9 sc) 12 times. 1 dc in last sc. Turn. 140 dc.
18th row: As 2nd row.
All sizes: Fasten off MC and A. 114 (128-140) sc.

RUFFLES
Note: Ruffles worked in MC rows only.
Turn work up-side down.
First Ruffle Row: (RS). Join MC with sl st to first rem loop of 2nd row of Yoke.
**1st row: Working from left to right, draw up a loop and place loop from hook onto knitting needle. Yarn over needle. Draw up a loop in same st as last loop and place loop from hook onto knitting needle. *(Yarn over needle. Draw up a loop. Yarn over needle) in next sc, placing loop from hook onto knitting needle. (Draw up a loop. Yarn over needle. Draw up a loop) in next sc, placing loops from hook onto knitting needle. Rep from * to end of row. Do not turn. 126 (132-132) loops on needle. Fasten off MC.
2nd row: Join A with sl st to first loop on needle. Ch 1. *Insert hook through next loop on needle. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off A.**
Second Ruffle Row: (RS). Join MC with sl st to first rem loop of 6th row of Yoke.
Rep from ** to ** as given for First Ruffle Row.
Third Ruffle Row: (RS). Join MC with sl st to first rem loop of 10th row of Yoke.
Rep from ** to ** as given for First Ruffle Row.
Sizes 12 and 18 mos only:
Fourth Ruffle Row: (RS). Join MC with sl st to first rem loop of 14th row of Yoke.
Rep from ** to ** as given for First Ruffle Row.
All sizes: Divide for Body and Sleeves: Work in rnds as follows:
1st rnd: (RS). Join MC with sl st to back loop of first sc. Ch 2 (does not count as st). Working through back (both-back) loops only, 1 hdc in each of first 18 (19-20) sc. Ch 2. Skip next 21 (26-30) sc. 1 hdc in each of next 36 (38-40) sc. Ch 2. Skip next 21 (26-30) sc. 1 hdc in each sc to end of row. Join with sl st to first hdc. 80 (84-88) sts (hdc and ch). PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd: (Eyelet rnd). Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. Ch 1. Skip last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 dc in each of first 4 (0-4) sts (ch or hdc). *2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of 5 (4-3) sts. Rep from * 11 (15-19) times more. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 88 (96-104) dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *3 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Dc3tog.** 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * ending at **. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
5th rnd: Sl st in next dc. Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *3 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Dc3tog.** 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * ending at **. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
6th rnd: Sl st in next dc. Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *5 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Dc3tog.** 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * ending at **. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
7th to 10th rnds: Sl st in next dc. Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *3 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Dc3tog.** 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * ending at **. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
11th rnd: Sl st in next dc. Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *5 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Dc3tog.** 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * ending at **. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
12th to 15th rnds: Sl st in next dc. Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *3 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Dc3tog.** 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * ending at **. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
16th rnd: Sl st in next dc. Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *5 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Dc3tog.** 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * ending at **. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
17th rnd: Sl st in next dc. Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. *3 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Dc3tog.** 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Rep from * ending at **. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
Rep last rnd until work from Dividing rnd measures 9 (10-11) [23 (25.5-28) cm]. Fasten off.
Sleeve edging: (RS). Join MC with sl st to 2nd ch of ch-2. Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 21 (26-30) sc. 1 dc in last ch. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.
Button band: 1st row: (RS). Join MC with sl st to top corner at back neck opening. Ch 1. Work 16 (18-20) sc evenly down back neck opening to dividing rnd. Turn.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Fasten off at end of last row.
Buttonhole band: 1st row: (RS). Join MC with sl st to bottom of back neck opening. Ch 1. Work 16 (18-20) sc evenly up back neck opening to foundation chain. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. [Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 (5-5) sc] twice. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and ch-2 sp to end of row. 16 (18-20) sc. Fasten off.
Sew buttons to Button band.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool DK Superwash™ (1.75 oz/50 g; 125 yds/114 m)
Contrast A Dark Gray Heather (12042) 3 3 4 5 5 balls
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amounts of orange and ochre DK weight yarn for embroidery.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit chest measurement 6 mos 17" [43 cm] 12 mos 18" [45.5 cm] 18 mos 19" [48 cm] 2 yrs 21" [53.5 cm] 4 yrs 23" [58.5 cm]. Length from shoulder to hem 6 mos 13½" [34.5 cm] 12 mos 15¼" [38.5 cm] 18 mos 17" [43 cm] 2 yrs 19" [48 cm] 4 yrs 21" [53.5 cm].
gauge: 17 sc and 20 rows= 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus (). When only one number is given, it applies to all sizes. For ease in working, circle all numbers pertaining to your size.

SKIRT
Notes: Skirt is worked in one piece in round. Carry color when not in use loosely up WS of work.

CROCHET  I  SKILL LEVEL: INTERMEDIATE

Beg at lower edge with A, ch 171 (180-189-198-207). Join in rnd with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist chain. See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). 1 dc in first ch. *Skip next 2 ch. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch – V st made. Rep from * to last 2 ch. Skip last 2 ch. Join B with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4.
2nd rnd: With B, sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in same sp as last sl st.
*(1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in ch-1 sp of next V st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc.
3rd rnd: Sl st in first ch-2 sp. Join A with sl st in next sc. *With A, working around last rnd, V st in sp between 2 groups of V-sts 2 rnds below. Rep from * around. Join B with sl st to first dc.
4th to 7th rnds: Rep 2nd and 3rd rnds twice more. Do not join B with sl st to first sc.
8th rnd: With A, as 2nd rnd.
9th rnd: Sl st in first ch-2 sp. Join B with sl st in next sc. *With B, working around last rnd, V st in sp between 2 groups of V sts 2 rnds below. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first dc.
Rep 8th and 9th rnds for pat until work from beg measures approx 8½ (10-11½-13-14½) [21.5 (25.5-29-33-37) cm], ending on an 9th rnd. Break B. Do not break A.

Bodice
1st rnd: With A, ch 1. *1 sc in ch-1 sp of next V st. Rep from * around. Join B with sl st to first sc. 57 (60-63-66-69) sc.
Note: To ensure pat of Bodice is consistent, the first rnds of Bodice will turn at end of following rnds until armhole, then the Bodice is worked back and forth in rows.

Sizes 6,12 and 18 mos only: 2nd rnd: With B, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 1 (4-7) sc. 1 sc in each of next 0 (0-2) sc. (2 sc in next sc) 1 (0-1) time. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 0 (2-2) times. 74 (78-82) sc. Turn.

Sizes 2 and 4 yrs only: 2nd rnd: With B, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 6 sc. 1 sc in each of next (6-0) sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) (0-2) times. (2 sc in next sc) (0-2) times. (86-94) sc.

All sizes: 3rd rnd: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
4th rnd: (RS). As 3rd rnd.
5th rnd: (WS). As 3rd rnd. Place marker on last st.

Back Bodice: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 31 (33-35-35-39) sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd to 5th rows: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 23 (25-27-27-31) sc at end of 5th row.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from marker measures 2½ (2¾-3-3½-4)" [6 (7-7.5-9-10) cm], ending on a WS row.

Right Back Strap: Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 8 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 7 sts.
**Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Strap measures 2½ (2½-3-3-3½)" [6 (6-7.5-7.5-9) cm], ending on a WS row. Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Ch 3. Skip next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
Next 2 rows: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sc at end of last row. Fasten off.**

Left Back Strap: Next row: (RS). Skip next 5 (7-9-9-13) sc. Join B with sl st in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 9 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 8 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 7 sts.
Rep from ** to ** as given for Right Back Strap.

Front Bodice: 1st row: (RS). Skip next 6 (6-6-8-8) sc. Join B with sl st in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. 1 sc in each of next 30 (32-34-34-38) sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd to 5th rows: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 23 (25-27-27-31) sc at end of 5th row.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from marker measures 1¾ (2-2¼-2¾-3¼)" [4.5 (5-5.5-7-8.5) cm], ending on a WS row.

Left Front Strap: Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 8 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 7 sts.
Next 3 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.

Right Front Strap: Next row: (RS). Skip next 5 (7-9-9-13) sc. Join B with sl st in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 8 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 7 sts.
Next 3 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. 5 sc. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Bodice edging: With RS facing, join B with sl st in center of left armhole edge. Ch 1. Work sc evenly around outer edges of Bodice. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Cross Stitch Embroidery: With red yarn, work cross stitch embroidery in each alternating sc around 3rd rnd of Bodice. Mark center front st of Bodice 2 (2-2-4-4) rows down from neck edge. Matching chart placement to center front st, using Red, Orange and Ochre yarn, work cross stitch embroidery from chart.
Drawstring: With 2 strands of A, make a chain 40 (44-44-48-48)" [101.5 (112-112-122-122) cm] long. Fasten off. Weave Drawstring through final rnd of A in Skirt below Bodice, having ends meet at center front. Sew on buttons to match buttonholes. Sew snap fasteners in position to secure ends of Straps.

materials: Red Heart® All in One™ Granny Square™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m)
Red Heart® All in One™ Flower Power™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements:
To fit chest measurement
XS/S/M 28-36" 71-91.5 cm]
L/XL/2X 38-48" [96.5-122 cm]
3/4/5X 50-62" [127-157.5 cm]
Finished chest
XS/S/M 36" [91.5 cm]
L/XL/2X 48" [122 cm]
3/4/5X 60" [152.5 cm]
gauge: Granny Square and Flower Power Motifs = Approx 6" [15 cm] square.
instructions:
The instructions are written for XS/S/M. If changes are necessary for larger sizes, the instructions are written XS/S/M (L/XL/2X-3/4/5X). When only one number is given, it applies to all sizes.

GRANNY SQUARE MOTIFS
Notes: 
• Motifs begin with Color 1 (shortest color rep) from center of pull-skein, leaving a 4" [10 cm] tail to weave in. 
• Each color aligns with 1 rnd in the Motif with 5 colors in total. If too much color is left at end of rnd, pull back some sts and slightly loosen gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change. If too little color is left, pull back some sts and slightly tighten gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change.
• When Motif is complete, cut yarn where Color 5 (longest color rep) ends leaving a tail for weaving in. Begin next Motif with Color 1 and repeat 5 rnds for each Motif.

Make 16 ( 20-26) with A. 
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. 
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc. Ch 3) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join. 
2nd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. 
3rd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. 
4th and 5th rnds: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1.** (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off.

FLOWER POWER MOTIF
Notes: 
• Motifs begin with Color 1 (shortest color rep) from center of pull-skein, leaving a 4" [10 cm] tail to weave in.
• 2nd and 3rd rnds will be worked in Color 2.
• 4th, 5th, and 6th rnds will be worked in Color 3.
• If too much color is left at end of 1st rnd (Color 1) or 3rd rnd (Color 2), pull back some sts and slightly loosen gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change. If too little color is left, pull back some sts and slightly tighten gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change.
• At end of final rnd, Motif should measure 6" [15 cm] square, with long tail (at least 24" [61 cm]) rem for seaming.
• Adjust gauge as needed while working 4th, 5th and 5th rounds of Flower Motif to maintain 6" [15 cm] square finished size to match Granny Square Motif.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st unless otherwise stated.

Make 10 ( 12-14) with B. 
Make 6 ( 8-10) with C.
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 9 dc in ring. Join. 10 dc. Color 1 complete.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. Color 2 begins. 2 dc in each dc around. Join. 20 dc.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next dc. (Ch 3. 1 tr) in same st as last sl st. 3 tr in next dc. (1 tr. 1 dc) in next dc. Sl st in next dc. *(1 dc. 1 tr) in next dc. 3 tr in next dc. (1 tr. 1 dc) in next dc. Sl st in next dc. Rep from * around, ending by joining with sl st to top of ch-3 of previous (2nd) rnd. Color 2 complete.
4th rnd: Color 3 begins. Sl st in first dc (top of ch-3 of 3rd rnd), to beg rnd at start of first Petal. Ch 3. *1 dc in next tr. 1 hdc in next tr. 1 sc in next tr. 1 hdc in next tr. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 tr in dc of 2nd rnd (below sl st).** 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * 3 times more, then from * to ** once. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 6 (counts as tr and ch-2). 1 tr in same sp as sl st. *2 dc in next st. Ch 1. 1 dc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Ch 1. 2 dc in next st.** (1 tr. Ch 2. 1 tr) all in next st. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join to 4th ch of ch-6.
6th rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2 ( does not count as st). 1 hdc in same ch-2 sp. Ch 3. 3 hdc in same ch-2 sp. Ch 1. *(3 hdc. Ch 1) in each ch-1 sp to next corner ch-2 sp.** (3 hdc. Ch 3. 3 hdc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 hdc in first ch-2 sp. Join. Fasten off at end of Color 3, leaving long tail for seaming. Motif should measure 6" [15 cm] square.

Size 3/4/5X only: Shoulder Motifs
Left Shoulder Motif: 1st row: (RS). Join C with sl st to any ch-3 sp of last rnd on a A Motif. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in same ch-3 sp. Ch 1. (Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in next sp. Ch 1) 4 times. Skip next 3 dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. Turn. 16 dc.
2nd and 4th rows: Ch 3. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 4 times. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Skip next dc. 1 dc in last dc (top of ch-3). Turn. 17 dc.
3rd and 5th rows: Ch 3. 1 dc in same dc. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 4 times. 2 dc in last dc (top of ch-3). Turn. 16 dc. Fasten off.
Right Shoulder Motif: Work as for Left Shoulder Motif.
FRONT & BACK (make 2 alike)
With C, sew 5 rows of 15 ( 15-20) Motifs tog, as shown in Assembly Diagram on page 4, through back loops only using whip st.
 Note: All Sizes - Motifs on shoulders will fold in half to create neck depth.
Shoulders: Sew 1 Motif at each side for shoulders ( see diagrams on page 4) noting Shoulder Motifs of 3/4/5X will have C section rows at neck edge. 
Size XS/S/M only: Sew side and shoulder seams. 
Sizes L/XL/2X and 3/4/5X only: Sew 4 Motifs along each side of Front to form extra width at side seams (see diagrams on page 4). Sew side and shoulder seams.

FiNISHING (All Sizes)
Neck Edging: (RS). Join C with sl st to any dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same dc. Work sts evenly around neck edge having 1 sc in each dc, 1 sc in each ch-3 corner sp, and 1 dc in each joining seam. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Armhole and Bottom Edging: Work as for Neck Edging around armholes and bottom edging.

materials: RED HEART® Baby Hugs™ Light: 1 (1, 1, 1) ball each 3258 Peachie A, 3724 Pinkie B, 3001 Frosting C, and 3410 Dolphin D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4 mm [US G-6]
abbreviations: A, B, C and D = Color A, Color B, Color C, and Color D
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 18 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 18 rows = 4” [10 cm], in single crochet.
instructions:
FRONT COLLAR
With A, ch 39 (43, 49, 55).
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 7 (9, 11, 13) ch for first strap, 3 sc in next ch (corner made), place a marker in the middle sc of 3-sc corner just made, sc in next 20 (20, 22, 24) ch for front, 3 sc in next ch, place a marker in the middle sc of 3-sc corner just made, sc in last 8 (10, 12, 14) ch for 2nd strap—42 (46, 52, 58) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, [sc in each st to next marked st, 3 sc in marked st and move marker to middle sc of 3-sc just made] twice, sc in each st to end of row—46 (50, 56, 62) sc.
Rows 3–8: Repeat Row 2 for 6 more times—70 (74, 80, 86) sc.
Fasten off. Do not remove markers.
BACK COLLAR
With D, ch 53 (57, 63, 69).
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 14 (16, 18, 20) ch for first strap, 3 sc in next ch (corner made), place a marker in the middle sc of 3-sc corner just made, sc in next 20 (20, 22, 24) ch for back, 3 sc in next ch, place a marker in the middle sc of 3-sc corner just made, sc in last 15 (17, 19, 21) ch for 2nd strap—56 (60, 66, 72) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, [sc in each st to next marked st, 3 sc in marked st and move marker to middle sc of 3-sc just made] twice, sc in each st to end of row—60 (64, 70, 76) sc.
Rows 3–8: Repeat Row 2 for 6 more times—84 (88, 94, 100) sc.
Fasten off. Do not remove markers.
SKIRT
Hold front and back collar pieces with wrong sides together, right sides facing out, and corner markers matching.
Join D with slip st in st following first marked stitch of back collar so that you are ready to work across the long edge towards the 2nd marked stitch.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, sc in each st to 2nd marked stitch of back collar, do not work in the marked st, ch 10 (12, 14, 14) for underarm, sc in st following first marked st of front collar, sc in each st to 2nd marked st of front collar, do not work in the marked st, ch 10 (12, 14, 14) for underarm; join with slip st in first sc of this round—72 (72, 76, 80) sc and 2 ch-10 (12, 14, 14) underarm chains. Remove the markers.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, working in each sc and ch, *ch 1, skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around to last st, ch 1, skip last st; join with slip st in first sc—46 (48, 52, 54) sc and 46 (48, 52, 54) ch-1 spaces. Fasten off D. 
Round 3: With right side facing, draw up a loop of C in first ch-space, ch 1, 2 sc in same ch-space, 2 sc in each ch-space around; join with slip st in first sc—92 (96, 104, 108) sc. Fasten off C. 
Round 4: With right side facing, draw up a loop of D in first space between 2-sc groups, ch 1, sc in same space, *ch 1, sc in next space between 2-sc groups; repeat from * around, ch 1; join with slip st in first sc—46 (48, 52, 54) sc and 46 (48, 52, 54) ch-1 spaces.
Fasten off D.
Round 5: With B, repeat Round 3. Fasten off B.
Round 6: With D, repeat Round 4. Fasten off D.
Round 7: With right side facing, draw up a loop of A in first ch-space, ch 1, 2 sc in same ch-space, 2 sc in each ch-space around; join with slip st in first sc—92 (96, 104, 108) sc. Fasten off A. 
Round 8: With right side facing, draw up a loop of D in first space between 2-st groups, ch 1, sc in same space, *ch 2, sc in next space between 2-st groups; repeat from * around, ch 2; join with slip st in first sc—46 (48, 52, 54) sc and 46 (48, 52, 54) ch-2 spaces.
Fasten off D.
Round 9: With C, repeat Round 7.
Fasten off C.
Round 10: With D, repeat Round 8.
Fasten off D.
Round 11: With B, repeat Round 7.
Fasten off B.
Round 12: With D, repeat Round 8.
Fasten off D.
Round 13: With A, repeat Round 7.
Fasten off A.
Round 14: With D, repeat Round 8.
Fasten off D.
Round 15: With right side facing, draw up a loop of C in first ch-space, ch 1, 3 sc in same ch-space, 3 sc in each ch-space around; join with slip st in first st—138 (144, 156, 162) sc.
Fasten off C.
Round 16: With right side facing, draw up a loop of D in first space between 3-st groups, ch 1, sc in same space, *ch 2, sc in next space between 3-st groups; repeat from * around, ch 2; join with slip st in first sc—46 (48, 52, 54) sc and 46 (48, 52, 54) ch-2 spaces.
Fasten off D.
Round 17: With B, repeat Round 15. 
Fasten off B.
Round 18: With D, repeat Round 16. 
Fasten off D.
Round 19: With A, repeat Round 15. 
Fasten off A.
Round 20: With right side facing, draw up a loop of D in first space between 3-st groups, ch 1, sc in same space, *ch 2, sc in next space between 3-st groups; repeat from * around, ch 2; join with slip st in first sc—46 (48, 52, 54) sc and 46 (48, 52, 54) ch-2 spaces.
Fasten off D.
Round 21: With right side facing, draw up a loop of C in first ch-space, ch 1, 3 hdc in same ch-space, 3 hdc in each ch-space around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—138 (144, 156, 162) hdc. Fasten off C.
Round 22: With D, repeat Round 20.
Fasten off D.
Round 23: With B, repeat Round 21.
Fasten off B.
Round 24: With D, repeat Round 20.
Fasten off D.
Round 25: With A, repeat Round 21.
Fasten off A.
Rounds 26–37: Repeat Rounds 20–25 twice.
Round 38: With right side facing, draw up a loop of D in first space between 3-st groups, ch 1, sc in same space, *ch 3, sc in next space between 3-st groups; repeat from * around, ch 3; join with slip st in first sc—46 (48, 52, 54) sc and 46 (48, 52, 54) ch-3 spaces.
Fasten off D.
Round 39: With right side facing, draw up a loop of C in first ch-space, ch 3 (counts as dc), 2 dc in same ch-space, 3 dc in each ch-space around; join with slip st in top of beg ch—138 (144, 156, 162) dc. Fasten off C.
Round 40: With D, repeat Round 38. 
Fasten off D.
Round 41: With B, repeat Round 39. 
Fasten off B.
Round 42: With D, repeat Round 38. 
Fasten off D.
Round 43: With A, repeat Round 39. 
Fasten off A.
Round 44: With right side facing, draw up a loop of D in first space between 3-st groups, ch 1, (sc , ch 3, sc) in same space, *ch 2, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next space between 3-st groups; repeat from * around, ch 2; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off D.
FINISHING
Front Collar Trim
With right side facing, join A with slip st in one lower corner of the front collar so that you are ready to work reverse sc all along the edges of the front collar. 
Row 1: Ch 1, work reverse sc evenly spaced up side edge of strap, across top of strap, down other side of strap, across front neck edge, up side of 2nd strap, across top of strap, and down last side of 2nd strap. 
Fasten off.
Back Collar Trim
With D, working along edges of back collar, work same as front collar trim.
Fold top of back straps over front straps and sew a pearl button through each overlap to seam straps.
Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® All in One™ Flower Power™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m)
Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Size U.S. I/9 [5.5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Sewing machine or needle and thread to seam fabric sections.
gauge: Motif = Approx 6" [15 cm] square. 12 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
FLOWER SQUARES
With MC, make 4 (4-6-6-8-8) Squares.
See Diagram on page 6.
Notes:
• Motifs begin with Color 1 (shortest color rep) from center of pull-skein, leaving a 4" [10 cm] tail to weave in.
• 2nd and 3rd rnds will be worked in Color 2.
• 4th, 5th, and 6th rnds will be worked in Color 3.
• If too much color is left at end of rnd, pull back some sts and slightly loosen gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change. If too little color is left, pull back some sts and slightly tighten gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change.
• At end of final rnd, Motif should measure 6" [15 cm] square, with long tail (at least 24" [61 cm]) rem for seaming.
• Adjust gauge as needed working 4th, 5th and 5th rounds of Flower Motif to maintain 6" [15 cm] square finished size to match Granny Square Motif.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st unless otherwise stated.
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 9 dc in ring. Join. 10 dc. Color 1 complete.
2nd rnd: With Color 2, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join. 20 dc.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next dc. (Ch 3. 1 tr) in same st as last sl st. 3 tr in next dc. (1 tr. 1 dc) in next dc. Sl st in next dc. *(1 dc. 1 tr) in next dc. 3 tr in next dc. (1 tr. 1 dc) in next dc. Sl st in next dc. Rep from * around, ending by joining with sl st to first sl st. Color 2 complete.
4th rnd: With Color 3, sl st in first dc (top of ch-3 of 3rd rnd), to beg rnd at start of first Petal. Ch 3. *1 dc in next tr. 1 hdc in next tr. 1 sc in next tr. 1 hdc in next tr. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 tr in dc of 2nd rnd below sl st.** 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * 3 times more, then from * to ** once. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 6 (counts as tr and ch-2). 1 tr in same sp as sl st. *2 dc in next st. Ch 1. 1 dc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Ch 1. 2 dc in next st.** (1 tr. Ch 2. 1 tr) all in next st. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join to 4th ch of ch-6.
6th rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in same ch-2 sp. Ch 3. 3 hdc in same ch-2 sp. Ch 1. *(3 hdc. Ch 1) in each ch-1 sp to next corner ch-2 sp.** (3 hdc. Ch 3. 3 hdc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 hdc in first ch-2 sp. Join.
Fasten off at end of Color 3, leaving long tail for seaming.
Motif should measure 6" [15 cm] square.
See Assembly Diagrams on page 7.
Using mattress stitch and A, seam Squares tog into 2 strips of 2 (2-3-3-4-4) Squares.
MATTRESS STITCH

Back Panel Extensions
See Diagrams on page 7.
Note: Back Panel Extension on right-hand side of Back Bodice is ½" [1.5 cm] longer than Extension on left-hand side – this accommodates overlap needed for buttons.
Right-hand Side Extension: With RS facing, join A with sl st to lower right corner ch-3 sp of Back Panel. Working up side of Panel, proceed as follows:
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in same ch-3 sp. 1 sc in each hdc and ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Turn. 21 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until Extension measures 3 (4-2-3-2-4)" [7.5 (10-5-7.5-5-10) cm]. Fasten off.
Left-hand Side Extension: With RS facing, join A with sl st to upper left corner ch-3 sp of Back Panel. Working down side of Panel, proceed as follows:
**1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in same ch-3 sp. 1 sc in each hdc and ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Turn. 21 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep 2nd row until Extension measures 2½ (3½-1½-2½-1½-3½)" [6.5 (9-4-6.5-4-9) cm].**
Fasten off.  
Front Panel Extensions
See diagrams on page 7. 
Left-hand Side Extension: With RS facing, join A with sl st to lower right corner ch-3 sp of Front Panel. 
Working up side of Panel, rep from ** to ** as given for Back Panel Extension. Fasten off.
Right-hand Side Extension: With RS facing, join A with sl st to upper left corner ch-3 sp of Front Panel. 
Working down side of Panel, rep from ** to ** as given for Back Panel Extension, ending on a WS row. 
Buttonholes: Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sts. (Ch 3. Skip next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts) 3 times. Ch 3. Skip next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sl st in first sc. Skip next sc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. [Skip next sc. Sl st in next sc. Skip next sc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp] 3 times. Skip next sc. Sl st in next sc. Fasten off. 
With RS facing tog and using mattress st, sew left side seam of Bodice.

Lower Bodice Edging
See Diagram on page 6.
With RS facing, join A with sl st to lower right corner of Bodice (marked with a red “x” in diagram on page 7). Ensure that you are not working into side of buttonhole band (the additional ½" [1.5 cm] worked on Right-hand Side Extension on Back). 
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Work 7 (10-4-7-4-10) sc evenly along edge of sc section to next Square. Working 1 sc in each ch-3 sp, ch-1 sp and hdc, work in sc across edge of next 2 (2-3-3-4-4) Squares. Work 16 (22-10-16-10-22) sc evenly along edge of sc section to next Square. Working 1 sc in each ch-3 sp, ch-1 sp and hdc, work in sc across edge of next 2 (2-3-3-4-4) Squares. Work 7 (10-4-7-4-10) sc evenly along edge of sc to end of row, leaving last ½" [1.5 cm] unworked for button band. Turn. 114 (126-144-156-186-210) sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Work in sc to end of row, evenly inc 0 (0-2-2-0-0) sts across row. Turn. 114 (126-146-158-186-210) sc.
3rd row: Ch 2. Working into front loops only, 1 dc in each of first 2 sc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of first 2 dc. 2 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 2. Work in dc to end of row, evenly inc 1 (1-5-5-1-1) st(s) across row. 115 (127-151-163-187-211) dc.
6th row: Ch 1. Sl st in first dc. *Skip next 2 dc. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next dc. Skip next 2 dc. Sl st in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off.
With RS facing, rejoin A to first unworked back loop from 3rd row. Next row: (Skirt joining row). Ch 2. 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
Note: This is row that fabric Skirt will be attached to.

Upper Bodice Edging 
See Diagram on page 6.
With RS facing, join A with sl st to upper left corner of Bodice, beg ½" [1.5 cm] from edge to leave Button Band unworked. 
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Work 7 (10-4-7-4-10) sc evenly along edge of sc section to next Square. Working 1 sc in each ch-3 sp, ch-1 sp and hdc, work in sc across edge of next 2 (2-3-3-4-4) Squares. Work 16 (22-10-16-10-22) sc evenly along edge of sc section to next Square. 
Working 1 sc in each ch-3 sp, ch-1 sp and hdc, work in sc across edge of next 2 (2-3-3-4-4) Squares. Work 7 (10-4-7-4-10) sc evenly along edge of sc to end of row, leaving last ½" unworked for button band. 114 (126-144-156-186-210) sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 12 (15-18-21-28-33) sc. Ch 4. Skip next 4 sc. 1 sc in each of next 25 (25-28-28-29-31) sc. Ch 4. Skip next 4 sc. 1 sc in each of next 24 (30-36-42-56-66) sc. Ch 4. Skip next 4 sc. 1 sc in each of next 25 (25-28-28-29-31) sc. Ch 4. Skip next 4 sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 98 (110-128-140-170-194) sc and 4 ch-4 sps. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and 4 sc in each ch-4 sp to end of row. 114 (126-144-156-186-210) sc. 
Fasten off.

Make Straps
Cut 2 strips of fabric approx 3" [7.5 cm] wide x 60" [152.5 cm] long. 
Taper ends slightly as shown in diagram, and overcast edges by hand or with a serger or sewing machine. 
Fold Strap in half and loop around ch-4 sp in Upper Bodice Edging. 
DRESS STRAP 1
DRESS STRAP 2
SKIRT
Note: The construction of your Dress will depend on the materials being used. You may want less fullness if your fabric is heavier, or more depending on your personal style. 
Cut Front and Back panels for Skirt. Sew side seams, leaving at least 2" [5 cm] open at top of right side seam.
Gather skirt until it matches Chest measurement to fit pieces of Bodice. 
If gathering with a sewing machine, decrease tension on your machine, and set machine to a long straight stitch. Pull a 6" [15 cm] tail of thread from both the needle and the bobbin. Do not backstitch at start of row. Stitch a line approx ¼" [0.5 cm] down from top of Skirt, breaking your sewing wherever you encounter a seam, ensuring that you leave long tails at both the start and stop of each new line of stitching. In same fashion, work an additional line ¼" [0.5 cm] below your initial row of stitching. You will now have 2 rows of gathering stitches.
Thread tails from needle (indicated in black)
Break stitching at seam lines
Thread tails from bobbin (indicated in red)
Once all lines of stitching are complete, take the bobbin threads in one hand and pull gently to gather fabric. 

Pull bobbin threads to gather 
You will need to manipulate the ruffles to ensure gathers are distributed evenly. Once gathers are distributed evenly, pin to crochet sts worked in Skirt Joining Row with RS facing (seam allowance will fall along interior of dress.) Sew tog using a straight stitch, using a 5/8" [1.6 cm] seam allowance. Ensure that Button and Buttonhole Bands are not captured in seam.
Sew Buttons to correspond with Buttonholes at side of dress. 

Finished measurements represent a skirt that is three times the fullness of the bodice measure. You may need to seam multiple panels together to achieve this width.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 530 Orchid A and 316 Soft White B
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 13 sts = 4” (10 cm); 9 rows = 4” (10 cm), in half double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
DRESS
Bodice
Round 1 (right side): With A, Fhdc 35 (38, 40, 45, 48); taking care not to twist sts, join with slip st in first Fhdc—35 (38, 40, 45, 48) sts. Note When completing round, work last stitch(es) in front of beginning chains and in skipped stitch before joining last stitch to first hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (does not count as a st here and throughout), skip next st, *hdc in next 6 (18, 19, 8, 23) sts, 2 (2, 1, 2, 2) hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—40 (40, 40, 50, 50) sts.
Round 3: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 3 (3, 3, 4, 4) sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—50 (50, 50, 60, 60) sts.
Round 4: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 4 (4, 4, 5, 5) sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—60 (60, 60, 70, 70) sts.
Round 5: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 5 (5, 5, 6, 6) sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—70 (70, 70, 80, 80) sts.
Directions are for size 3 months. Changes for sizes 6 months, 12 months, 18 months, and 24 months are in parentheses.
Special Stitches
dc3tog = [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops] 3 times, yarn over, draw through all 4 loops on hook.
Fhdc (Foundation half double crochet (This technique creates a foundation chain and a row of half double crochet stitches in one) = Step 1: Place a slip knot on hook, ch 3, yarn over, insert hook in 3rd ch from hook and draw up a loop; yarn over and draw through one loop on hook (the “chain”); yarn over and draw through 3 loops on hook (the “half double crochet”). Step 2: Yarn over, insert hook into the “chain” of the previous stitch and draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through one loop on hook (the “chain”), yarn over and draw through 3 loops on hook (the “half double crochet”). Repeat step 2 for the length of foundation.
hdc2tog = [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop] 2 times, yarn over and draw through all 5 loops on hook.
Notes
1. Dress is worked from the top down in 2 sections: bodice and skirt.
2. Bodice is worked in seamlessly joined rounds with right side facing at all times. One stitch is skipped at the beginning of each round and the last stitch(es) are worked into the skipped stitch before joining the round with a slip stitch.
See schematic and diagram on next page...
Size 3 months only:
Round 6: Ch 2, skip next st, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 8 sts, 2 hdc in next st, *hdc in next 9 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—78 sts.
Round 7: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 17 sts, ch 1, skip next 17 sts, hdc in next 22 sts (armhole made), ch 1, skip next 17 sts, hdc in last 5 sts (armhole made); join with slip st in first st—44 sts and 2 ch.
Size 6 months only:
Round 6: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 6 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—80 sts.
Round 7: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 19 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—84 sts.
Round 8: Ch 2, skip next st, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 18 sts, ch 1, skip next 18 sts, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 23 sts (armhole made), ch 1, skip next 18 sts, hdc in last 5 sts (armhole made); join with slip st in first st—50 sts and 2 ch.
Size 12 months only:
Round 6: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 6 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—80 sts.
Round 7: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 9 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—88 sts.
Round 8: Ch 2, skip next st, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first st.
Round 9: Ch 2, skip next st, hdc in next 20 sts, ch 1, skip next 19 sts, hdc in next 25 sts (armhole made), ch 1, skip next 19 sts, hdc in last 5 sts (armhole made); join with slip st in first st—50 sts and 2 ch.
Size 18 months only:
Round 6: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 7 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—90 sts.
Round 7: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 44 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—92 sts.
Rounds 8 and 9: Ch 2, skip next st, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first st.
Round 10: Ch 2, skip next st, hdc in next 21 sts, ch 1, skip next 20 sts, hdc in next 26 sts (armhole made), ch 1, skip next 20 sts, hdc in last 5 sts (armhole made); join with slip st in first st—52 sts and 2 ch.
Size 24 months only:
Round 6: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 7 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—90 sts.
Round 7: Ch 2, skip next st, hdc in next 10 sts, *hdc in next 9 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—98 sts.
Rounds 8–10: Ch 2, skip next st, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first st.
Round 11: Ch 2, skip next st, hdc in next 23 sts, ch 1, skip next 21 sts, hdc in next 28 sts (armhole made), ch 1, skip next 21 sts, hdc in last 5 sts (armhole made); join with slip st in first st—56 sts and 2 ch.
All sizes:
Round 8 (9, 10, 11, 12): Ch 2, skip next st, hdc in each st and ch; join with slip st in first st—46 (52, 52, 54, 58) sts.
Round 9 (10, 11, 12, 13): Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 22 (25, 25, 26, 28) sts, 2 (2, 2, 1, 2) hdc in next st; repeat from * once; join with slip st in first st—48 (54, 54, 54, 60) sts.
Skirt
Round 10 (11, 12, 13, 14): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 2 dc in same st as join, *dc in next st, dc3tog, dc in next st, 3 dc in next st; repeat from * to last 5 sts, dc in next st, dc3tog, dc in last st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 (54, 54, 54, 60) sts.
Note The following rounds (except the last) begin with a slip st in center dc of first 3-dc group. The “last st” of each round is worked in the first dc of the first 3-dc group (same as the joining stitch of the previous round).
Round 11 (12, 13, 14, 15): Slip st in next st; change to B, ch 3, 2 dc in same st, *dc in next 2 sts, beginning in last st worked, dc3tog, dc in same st as last “leg” of dc3tog, dc in next st, 3 dc in next st; repeat from * to last 5 sts, dc in next 2 sts, beginning in last st worked, dc3tog, dc in same st as last “leg” of dc3tog, dc in last st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—64 (72, 72, 72, 80) sts.
Round 12 (13, 14, 15, 16): Slip st in next st, ch 3, 2 dc in same st, *dc in next 3 sts, beginning in st just worked, dc3tog, dc in same st as last “leg” of dc3tog, dc in next 2 sts, 3 dc in next st; repeat from * to last 7 sts, dc in next 3 sts, beginning in st just worked, dc3tog, dc in same st as last “leg” of dc3tog, dc in last 2 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—80 (90, 90, 90, 100) sts.
Round 13 (14, 15, 16, 17): Slip st in next st; change to A, ch 3, 2 dc in same st, *dc in next 3 sts, dc3tog, dc in next 3 sts, 3 dc in next st; repeat from * to last 9 sts, dc in next 3 sts, dc3tog, dc in last 3 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Rounds 14 (15, 16, 17, 18)–21 (24, 25, 28, 30): Repeat Round 13 (14, 15, 16, 17) eight (ten, ten, twelve, thirteen) times and change color as in the following color sequence: Work 1 (1, 1, 1, 1) round with A, 2 (2, 2, 2, 2) rounds with B, 2 (2, 2, 2, 2) rounds with A, 2 (2, 2, 2, 2) rounds with B, 1 (2, 2, 2, 2) round(s) with A, 0 (1, 1, 2, 2) round(s) with B, 0 (0, 0, 1, 2) round(s) with A.
Do not change color.
Last Round: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, dc in next 3 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, *sc in next 3 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, dc in next 3 sts, hdc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Neckline
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing, join A with slip st in center st at back of Round 1, ch 1, sc in same st and in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—35 (38, 40, 45, 48) sts. Fasten off.
Sleeve Edging (work 2)
Notes Edging is worked in continuous rounds. Do not join at end of Round 1. Flatten dress so you can determine the center stitch of the underarm. You may want to place a stitch marker on this stitch.
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing, join A with slip st in st at back of sleeve, ch 1, skip first st, hdc in each st to 2 sts before center st of underarm, hdc2tog, hdc in center st, hdc2tog, hdc in remaining sts, working last hdc in first skipped st—18 (19, 20, 21, 22).
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first st. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Block if necessary.
